verses.roman:
ajānatā kṛtam idaṁ
pāpena madhusūdana
kṣantum arhasi pāpasya
uttamaḥśloka me 'nagha

synonyms: ajānatā—who was acting without knowledge; kṛtam—has been done; idam—this; pāpena—by a sinful person; madhusūdana—O Madhusūdana; kṣantum arhasi—please forgive; pāpasya—of the sinful person; uttamaḥ-śloka—O glorious Lord; me—my; anagha—O sinless one.
translation: Jarā said: O Lord Madhusūdana, I am a most sinful person. I have committed this act out of ignorance. O purest Lord, O Uttamaḥśloka, please forgive this sinner.
